alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage; Pawnee; Tulsa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 6:23PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN OSAGE...WESTERN CREEK...SOUTHEASTERN PAWNEE AND WEST CENTRAL TULSA COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM CDT... At 623 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Hominy to 3 miles northwest of Depew. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Sand Springs... Bristow... Hominy... Cleveland... Mannford... Drumright... Oilton... Depew... Avant... Westport... Osage... Terlton... Shamrock... Keystone State Park... Walnut Creek State Park... Silver City... Milfay... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 178 and 202. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
